item.title: Black Ice, 5th January
item.description:
Chris Whitty place and Bushell Way are extremely icy and slippery. It is very dangerous as I have been injured slipping on the ice. The roads and pavements need gritting

item.title: Fly tipping in the rubbish area next to Barbrook House, 5th January
item.description:
There is a continuous amount of random rubbish in this area that does not necessarily come from the neighbours in this building. The rubbish right now has been here for about three days but there is always something without fail.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Paragon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street light deflector shield, 5th January
item.description:
When the street lights were upgraded to a new brighter light no street light deflector shields were put in place at the same time, which has created an unnecessary and unreasonable backspill into my house at night and glows through my curtains at an unreasonable brightness limiting my sleep. I would like to request that this is installed so I do not have to endure this unreasonable impact upon my personal life for which I have no ability to resolve myself. Other councils do put such measures in place.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Randall Place, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak frozen in front of vehicle entrance, 5th January
item.description:
The water is coming from the Jet petrol station Chipperfield road BR5 2QR it has recently had the forecourt refurbished and two Jet washers have been installed. Excess waste water misses the forecourt gutter and flows onto the pavement and Chipperfield road. The water sits and stagnates and begins to smell. The water has now frozen in front of a main vehicle entrance to 99 and 101 Chipperfield road making it a serious hazard to road users entering and exiting the premises. This issue was reported a year ago and has not been fixed. It is only a matter of time before someone has a serious accident due to this and makes a civil liability insurance claim.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole, 5th January
item.description:
This pothole is progressively getting worse, now has a ledge to it which could potentially create a tripping hazard in the road if crossing there. It has been there since last year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hall Place Crescent, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
